metadata.Title: CVE-2021-46657 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
get_sort_by_table in MariaDB before 10.6.2 allows an application crash viacertain subquery uses of ORDER BY.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46657` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.6.2-1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-client - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-client-10.6 - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-client-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-common - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-server - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-server-10.6 - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-server-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-test - 1:10.6.2-1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.6.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.6 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.2-1').
